title.narrative: Kiribati trade capacity development and institutional strengthening project

description.narrative: This project supports Kiribati to benefit from trade by developing national capacities to formulate, implement, and assess trade-related strategies that are aligned with the Kiribati Development Plan. In doing so, the project will address institutional capacity constraints by encompassing sustainable development and gender perspectives. The project will help Kiribati establishing a development oriented trade policy framework that encompasses the linkages between trade, human development and poverty reduction. The project will adopt a whole of government approach to mainstreaming trade and aid coordination. It will also directly support the participation of trade stakeholders in the private sector and civil society in trade policy making. The project will be implemented by the Business Promotion Centre at the Ministry of Commerce, Industry and Cooperatives.

participating-org.narrative: National Implementing Entity (NIE) Government of Kiribati, Ministry of Commerce, Industry and Cooperatives

provider-org.narrative: UNOPS helps the UN and its partners run peacebuilding, humanitarian and development operations for people in need.
UNOPS helps the UN and its partners run peacebuilding, humanitarian and development operations for people in need.
